chargeHist.descr: Battery to Emergency Medical Care Providers

result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick A. Stephens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Misdemeanor Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
** 4 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Frederick A. Stephens

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:40 AM.
Defendant Frederick A. Stephens in court with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant pleads No Contest to an amended Count 1: Attempted Battery. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty.
Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 1 Year of Probation with the following conditions:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 30 Days of Jail stayed pending further order of the Court.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.  Court Costs/surcharges. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Defendant is granted 4 days of sentence credit. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

10:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick A. Stephens in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Frederick A. Stephens. Parties are close to an agreement.
Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Frederick A. Stephens in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Frederick A. Stephens.
Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
